                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(10,994</font></td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">)</font></td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="76%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Accounts
                    receivable &#8211; net</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">64,992</font></td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">51,194</font></td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We
          continuously evaluate the payment
          history and financial strength of our operators and have historically
          established allowance reserves for straight-line rent adjustments for operators
          that do not meet our requirements.&#160;&#160;We consider factors such as
          payment history, the operator&#8217;s financial condition as well as current and
          future anticipated operating trends when evaluating whether to establish
          allowance reserves.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
          the first quarter of 2007, we reversed approximately $5.0 million of allowance
          for straight-line rent previously established, as a result of the improvement
          in
          one of our operator&#8217;s financial condition.&#160;&#160;We record allowances for
          straight-line rent receivables as an adjustment to
          revenue.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, the reversal of this allowance increased
          revenue for the three months ended March 31, 2007 and twelve months ended
          December 31, 2007.&#160;&#160;The change in estimate resulted in an additional
          $0.08 per share of income from continuing operations and net income for
          the
          first quarter of 2007 and for the twelve months ended December 31,
          2007.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Investments
          in Debt and Equity Securities</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Marketable
          securities classified as
          available-for-sale are stated at fair value with unrealized gains and losses
          recorded in accumulated other comprehensive income.&#160;&#160;Realized gains
          and losses and declines in value judged to be other-than-temporary on securities
          held as available-for-sale are included in other income. The cost of securities
          sold is based on the specific identification method. If events or circumstances
          indicate that the fair value of an investment has declined below its carrying
          value and we consider the decline to be &#8220;other than temporary,&#8221; the investment
          is written down to fair value and an impairment loss is recognized.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In
          accordance with SFAS No. 115, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for Certain
          Investments
          in Debt and Equity Securities </font>(&#8220;FAS No. 115&#8221;), during the year ended
          December 31, 2005, we recorded a $3.4 million provision for impairment
          to
          write-down our 760,000 share investment in Sun Healthcare Group, Inc. (&#8220;Sun&#8221;)
          common stock to its then current fair market value.&#160;&#160;During the year
          ended December 31, 2006, we sold our remaining 760,000 shares of Sun&#8217;s common
          stock for approximately $7.6 million, realizing a gain on the sale of these
          securities of approximately $2.7 million.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">F-10</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
                HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
                TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="HDR">
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a href="#toc">Table
              of Contents</a></font></div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;We
          record
          dividend and accretion income on preferred stock based upon whether the
          amount
          and timing of collections are both probable and reasonably
          estimable.&#160;&#160;We recognize accretion income on a prospective basis using
          the effective interest method to the redemption date of the
          security.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our
          investment in Advocat, Inc.
          (&#8220;Advocat&#8221;) Series B preferred stock was classified as an available-for-sale
          security.&#160;&#160;The face value plus the value of the accrued dividends,
          which had previously been written down to zero due to impairment, were
          accreted
          into income ratably through the Omega redemption date (September 30,
          2007).&#160;&#160;The cumulative amount recognized as income was limited to the
          fair market value of the preferred stock.&#160;&#160;The difference between the
          fair market value of the preferred stock and the accretive value of the
          security
          was recorded as other comprehensive income on the balance sheet.&#160;&#160;The
          Advocat Series B preferred stock was exchanged for the Advocat Series C
          preferred stock on October 20, 2006.&#160;&#160;See Note 5 &#8211; Other
          Investments.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>At
          December 31, 2006 and 2007, we had
          one preferred stock investment security (i.e., Series C preferred shares
          of
          Advocat, a publicly traded company).&#160;&#160;This security is classified as a
          held-to-maturity security and was acquired in the Advocat
          restructuring.&#160;&#160;It was initially recorded at fair value and will be
          accreted to its mandatory redemption value.&#160;&#160;See Note 5 &#8211; Other
          Investments.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Comprehensive
          Income</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>SFAS
          130, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Reporting Comprehensive
          Income</font>, establishes guidelines for the reporting and display of
          comprehensive income and its components in financial
          statements.&#160;&#160;Comprehensive income includes net income and all other
          non-owner changes in stockholders&#8217; equity during a period including unrealized
          gains and losses on equity securities classified as available-for-sale
          and
          unrealized fair value adjustments on certain derivative
          instruments.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Deferred
          Financing Costs</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>External
          costs incurred from placement
          of our debt are capitalized and amortized on a straight-line basis over
          the
          terms of the related borrowings which approximate the effective interest
          method.
          Amortization of financing costs totaling $2.0 million, $2.0 million and
          $2.1
          million in 2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively, is classified as &#8220;interest -
          amortization of deferred financing costs&#8221; in our audited consolidated statements
          of operations.&#160;&#160;When financings are terminated, unamortized amounts
          paid, as well as, charges incurred for the termination, are expensed at
          the time
          the termination is made.&#160;&#160;Gains and losses from the extinguishment of
          debt are presented as interest expense within income from continuing operations
          in the accompanying consolidated financial statements.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Revenue
          Recognition</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We
          have various different investments
          that generate revenue, including leased and mortgaged properties, as well
          as,
          other investments, including working capital loans.&#160;&#160;We recognized
          rental income and mortgage interest income and other investment income
          as earned
          over the terms of the related master leases and notes,
          respectively.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Substantially
          all of our leases contain
          provisions for specified annual increases over the rents of the prior year
          and
          are generally computed in one of three methods depending on specific provisions
          of each lease as follows: (i) a specific annual increase over the prior
          year&#8217;s
          rent, generally 2.5%; (ii) an increase based on the change in pre-determined
          formulas from year to year (i.e., such as increases in the CPI); or (iii)
          specific dollar increases over prior years.&#160;&#160;Revenue under lease
          arrangements with specific determinable increases is recognized over the
          term of
          the lease on a straight-line basis.&#160;&#160;SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin No.
          101 <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Revenue Recognition
          in
          Financial Statements</font> does not provide for the recognition of contingent
          revenue until all possible contingencies have been eliminated.&#160;&#160;We
          consider the operating history of the lessee, the payment history, the
          general
          condition of the industry and various other factors when evaluating whether
          all
          possible contingencies have been eliminated.&#160;&#160;We have historically not
          included, and generally expect in the future not to include, contingent
          rents as
          income until received.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In
          the case of rental revenue
          recognized on a straight-line basis, we generally record reserves against
          earned
          revenues from leases when collection becomes questionable or when negotiations
          for restructurings of troubled operators result in significant uncertainty
          regarding ultimate collection.&#160;&#160;The amount of the reserve is estimated
          based on what management believes will likely be collected.&#160;&#160;We
          continually evaluate the collectability of our straight-line rent
          assets.&#160;&#160;If it appears that we will not collect future rent due under
          our leases, we will record a provision for loss related to the straight-line
          rent asset.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">F-11</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
                HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
                TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="HDR">
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a href="#toc">Table
              of Contents</a></font></div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Recognizing
          rental income on a straight-line basis results may cause recognized revenue
          exceeding contractual amounts due from our tenants.&#160;&#160;Such cumulative
          excess amounts are included in accounts receivable and were $33.9 million
          and
          $20.1 million, net of allowances, at December 31, 2007 and 2006,
          respectively.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Gains
          on
          sales of real estate assets are recognized pursuant to the provisions of
          SFAS
          No. 66, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for Sales
          of Real Estate </font>(&#8220;SFAS No. 66&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The specific timing of the
          recognition of the sale and the related gain is measured against the various
          criteria in SFAS No. 66 related to the terms of the transactions and any
          continuing involvement associated with the assets sold.&#160;&#160;To the extent
          the sales criteria are not met, we defer gain recognition until the sales
          criteria are met.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Assets
          Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Pursuant
          to the provisions of SFAS No.
          144, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for the
          Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets </font>(&#8220;SFAS No. 144&#8221;), the
          operating results of specified real estate assets that have been sold,
          or
          otherwise qualify as held for disposition (as defined by SFAS No. 144),
          are
          reflected as assets held for sale in our balance sheet.&#160;&#160;Assets that
          qualify as held for sale may also be considered as a discontinued operation
          if,
          (a) the operation and cash flows of the asset have been or will be eliminated
          from future operations and (b) we will not have significant involvement
          with the
          asset after its disposition. For assets that qualify as discontinued operations,
          we have reclassified the operations of those assets to discontinued operations
          in the consolidated statements of operations for all periods presented
          and
          assets held for sale in the consolidated balance sheet for all periods
          presented.&#160;&#160;We had three assets held for sale as of December 31, 2007
          with a combined net book value of $2.9 million.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>For
          additional information, see Note 18
&#8211; Discontinued Operations.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Derivative
          Instruments</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We
          follow SFAS No. 133, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for Derivative
          Instruments and Hedging Activities</font>, as amended, (&#8220;FAS No.
          133&#8221;).&#160;&#160;From time to time we may use derivatives financial instruments
          to manage interest rates.&#160;&#160;These instruments include options,
          forwards, interest rate swaps, caps or floors or a combination thereof
          depending
          on the underlying exposure.&#160;&#160;We may employ swaps, forwards or purchase
          options to hedge qualifying forecasted transactions.&#160;&#160;We do not use
          derivatives for trading or speculative purposes.&#160;&#160;On the date we
          entered into a derivative, the derivate is designated as a hedge of the
          identified exposure.&#160;&#160;We measure the effectiveness of its hedging
          relationships both at the hedge inception and on an ongoing basis.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>FAS
          133 requires that all derivatives
          are recognized on the balance sheet at fair value.&#160;&#160;Derivatives that
          are not hedges are adjusted to fair value through income.&#160;&#160;If the
          derivative is a hedge, depending on the nature of the hedge, changes in
          the fair
          value of derivatives are either offset against the change in fair value
          of the
          hedged assets, liabilities, or firm commitments through earnings or recognized
          in other comprehensive income until the hedge item is recognized in earnings.
          Gains and losses related to hedged transaction are deferred and recognized
          as
          interest expense in the period or periods that the underlying transaction
          occurs, expires or is otherwise terminated. The ineffective portion of
          a
          derivative&#8217;s change in fair value will be immediately recognized in
          earnings.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>At
          December 31, 2007 and 2006, we had
          no derivative instruments.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Earnings
          Per Share</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Basic
          earnings per common share (&#8220;EPS&#8221;)
          is computed by dividing net income available to common stockholders by
          the
          weighted-average number of shares of common stock outstanding during the
          year.&#160;&#160;Diluted EPS reflects the potential dilution that could occur
          from shares issuable through stock-based compensation, including stock
          options
          and restricted stock.&#160;&#160;For additional information, see Note 17 &#8211;
Earnings Per Share.</font></div><br>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">&#160;</div>
            </div>
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">F-12</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
                HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
                TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="HDR">
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a href="#toc">Table
              of Contents</a></font></div>
          </div>
        </div><br>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Income
          Taxes</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We
          were organized to qualify for
          taxation as a REIT under Section 856 through 860 of the Internal Revenue
          Code.&#160;&#160;So long as we qualify as a REIT; we will not be subject to
          Federal income taxes on the REIT taxable income that we distributed to
          shareholders, subject to certain exceptions.&#160;&#160;In 2007, we paid
          preferred and common dividend payments of $81.3 million which satisfies
          the 2007
          REIT requirements relating to qualifying income.&#160;&#160;We are permitted to
          own up to 100% of a &#8220;taxable REIT subsidiary&#8221; (&#8220;TRS&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Currently, we
          have one TRS that is taxable as a corporation and that pays federal, state
          and
          local income tax on its net income at the applicable corporate
          rates.&#160;&#160;The TRS had a net operating loss carry-forward as of December
          31, 2007 of $1.1 million.&#160;&#160;The loss carry-forward was fully reserved
          with a valuation allowance due to uncertainties regarding
          realization.&#160;&#160;We record interest and penalty charges associated with
          tax matters as income tax.&#160;&#160;For additional information on income
          taxes, see Note 10 &#8211; Taxes.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On
          January 1, 2008, we
          adopted&#160;Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#8220;FASB&#8221;)&#160;Interpretation
          No. 48 (&#8220;FIN 48&#8221;), <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting
          for Uncertainty in Income Taxes,</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">an interpretation
          of FASB Statement
          No. 109</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for
          Income Taxes</font>.&#160;&#160;FIN 48 clarifies the accounting for uncertainty
          in income taxes recognized in an enterprise&#8217;s financial statements in accordance
          with FASB Statement No. 109, by defining a criterion that an individual
          tax
          position must meet for any part of that position to be recognized in an
          enterprise&#8217;s financial statements.&#160;&#160;The interpretation requires a
          review of all tax positions accounted for in accordance with FASB Statement
          No.
          109 and applies a more-likely-than-not recognition threshold.&#160;&#160;A tax
          position that meets the more-likely-than-not recognition threshold is initially
          and subsequently measured as the largest amount of tax benefit that is
          greater
          than 50 percent likely of being realized upon ultimate settlement with
          the
          taxing authority that has full knowledge of all relevant
          information.&#160;&#160;We are subject to the provisions of FIN 48 beginning
          January 1, 2007.&#160;&#160;We evaluated FIN 48 and determined that the adoption
          of FIN 48 had no impact on our financial statements.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Stock-Based
          Compensation</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Prior
          to January 1, 2006, we accounted
          for stock based compensation using the intrinsic value method as defined
          by APB
          Opinion No. 25, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for
          Stock Issued to Employees </font>(&#8220;APB 25&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Under APB 25, we
          generally recognized compensation expense only for restricted stock
          grants.&#160;&#160;We have recognized the compensation expense associated with
          the restricted stock ratably over the associated service period.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Effective
          January 1, 2006, we adopted
          the provisions of SFAS No. 123 (revised 2004), <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Share-Based Payment</font> (&#8220;SFAS
          123(R)&#8221;), using the modified prospective transition method, and therefore has
          not restated the results of prior periods.&#160;&#160;The additional expense
          recorded in 2006 as a result of this adoption is approximately $3
          thousand.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
          following table presents the effect on net income and earnings per share
          if we
          had applied the fair value recognition provisions of SFAS No. 123(R) to
          our
          stock-based compensation granted prior to January 1, 2006.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>

                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="64%">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Earnings
                    per share:</font></div>
                </td>
                <td valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

                <td valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="64%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Basic,
                    as reported</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">0.90</font></td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">0.78</font></td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">F-13</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
                HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
                TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="HDR">
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a href="#toc">Table
              of Contents</a></font></div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Effects
          of Recently Issued Accounting Standards</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">FAS
          157
          Evaluation</font></font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In
          September 2006, the FASB issued
          Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 157, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Fair Value Measurements
</font>(&#8220;FAS
          No. 157&#8221;).&#160;&#160;This standard defines fair value, establishes a
          methodology for measuring fair value and expands the required disclosure
          for
          fair value measurements.&#160;&#160;FAS No. 157 emphasizes that fair value is a
          market-based measurement, not an entity-specific measurement, and states
          that a
          fair value measurement should be determined based on the assumptions that
          market
          participants would use in pricing the asset or liability.&#160;&#160;This
          statement applies under other accounting pronouncements that require or
          permit
          fair value measurements, the FASB having previously concluded in those
          pronouncements that fair value is the relevant measurement
          attribute.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, this statement does not require any new fair
          value measurements.&#160;&#160;FAS No. 157 is effective for fiscal years
          beginning after November 15, 2007, and we intend to adopt the standard
          on
          January 1, 2008.&#160;&#160;We are currently evaluating the impact, if any, FAS
          No. 157 will have on our financial statements, but do not believe the effect
          will be material.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">FAS
          159
          Evaluation</font></font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In
          February 2007, the FASB issued
          Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (&#8220;FAS&#8221;) No. 159, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">The Fair Value Option
          for Financial
          Assets and Financial Liabilities </font>(&#8220;SFAS No. 159&#8221;).&#160;&#160;SFAS No.
          159 permits entities to choose to measure certain financial assets and
          liabilities at fair value, with the change in unrealized gains and losses
          on
          items for which the fair value option has been elected and reported in
          earnings.&#160;&#160;SFAS No. 159 is effective for fiscal years beginning after
          November 15, 2007.&#160;&#160;We are currently evaluating the impact, if any,
          SFAS No. 159 will have on our financial statements, but do not believe
          the
          effect will be material.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">FAS
          141(R)
          Evaluation</font></font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On
          December 4, 2007, the FASB issued
          Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 141(R), <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Business Combinations</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; COLOR: #212100; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font>(FAS
          141(R)).&#160;&#160;The new standard will significantly change the accounting
          for and reporting of business combination transactions.&#160;&#160;FAS 141(R)
          requires companies to recognize, with certain exception, 100 percent of
          the fair
          value of the assets acquired, liabilities assumed and non-controlling interest
          in acquisitions of less than a 100 percent controlling interest when the
          acquisition constitutes a change in control; measure acquirer shares issued
          as
          consideration for a business combination at fair value on the date of the
          acquisition; recognize contingent consideration arrangements at their
          acquisition date fair value, with subsequent change in fair value generally
          reflected in earnings; recognition of reacquisition loss and gain contingencies
          at their acquisition date fair value; capitalize in process research and
          development assets acquired; expense as incurred, acquisition related
          transaction costs; capitalize acquisition-related restructuring costs only
          if
          the criteria in Financial Accounting Standards Board No. 146, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for Costs
          associated with
          Exit or Disposal Activities</font> are met as of the date of the acquisition;
          and recognizing changes that result from a business combination transaction
          in
          an acquirer&#8217;s existing income tax valuation allowance and tax uncertainty
          accruals as adjustment to income tax expense.&#160;&#160;FAS 141(R) is effective
          for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2008 and early adoption is
          prohibited.&#160;&#160;We intend to adopt the standard on January 1,
          2009.&#160;&#160;We are currently evaluating the impact, if any, FAS 141(R) will
          have on our financial statements.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Risks
          and Uncertainties</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our
          company is subject to certain risks
          and uncertainties affecting the healthcare industry as a result of healthcare
          legislation and growing regulation by federal, state and local governments.
          Additionally, we are subject to risks and uncertainties as a result of
          changes
          affecting operators of nursing home facilities due to the actions of
          governmental agencies and insurers to limit the growth in cost of healthcare
          services (see Note 6 - Concentration of Risk).</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Reclassifications</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Certain
          amounts in the prior year have
          been reclassified to conform to the 2007 presentation and to reflect the
          results
          of discontinued operations.&#160;&#160;See Note 18 &#8211; Discontinued Operations for
          a discussion of discontinued operations.&#160;&#160;Such reclassifications have
          no effect on previously reported earnings or equity</font>.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">F-14</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
                HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
                TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="HDR">
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a href="#toc">Table
              of Contents</a></font></div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
          3 - PROPERTIES</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Leased
          Property</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our
          leased real estate properties,
          represented by 222 long-term care facilities and two rehabilitation hospitals
          at
          December 31, 2007, are leased under provisions of single leases and master
          leases with initial terms typically ranging from 5 to 10 years, plus renewal
          options.&#160;&#160;Substantially all of the leases and master leases provide
          for minimum annual rentals that are typically subject to annual increases
          based
          upon the lesser of a fixed amount or increases derived from changes in
          CPI.&#160;&#160;Under the terms of the leases, the lessee is responsible for all
          maintenance, repairs, taxes and insurance on the leased properties.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A
          summary
          of our investment in leased real estate properties is as follows:</font></div>

        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Below
          is
          a summary of the significant lease transactions that occurred in
          2007.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Signature
          Holding II, LLC</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>During
          the third quarter of 2007, we
          completed a transaction with Litchfield Investment Company, LLC and its
          affiliates (&#8220;Litchfield&#8221;) to purchase five (5) SNFs for a total investment of
          $39.5 million.&#160;&#160;The facilities total 645 beds and are located in
          Alabama (1), Georgia (2), Kentucky (1) and Tennessee (1).&#160;&#160;We also
          provided a $2.5 million loan in the form of a subordinated note as part
          of the
          transaction, which was repaid in full during the fourth quarter
          2007.&#160;&#160;Simultaneously with the close of the purchase transaction, the
          facilities were combined into an Amended and Restated Master Lease with
          Signature Holding II, LLC (formerly known as Home Quality Management,
          Inc.)&#160;&#160;The Amended and Restated Master Lease was extended until July
          31, 2017.&#160;&#160;The investment allocated to land, building and personal
          property is $6.3 million, $32.1 million and $1.1 million,
          respectively.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">USA
          Healthcare</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>During
          the third quarter of 2007, we
          continued our restructure of a five (5) facility master lease with USA
          Healthcare whereby we have agreed to sell three (3) facilities and reduce
          the
          overall annual rent on the master lease by $0.4 million.&#160;&#160;During the
          fourth quarter of 2007, two (2) of the facilities were sold for approximately
          $2.8 million in cash proceeds and the overall annual rent on the master
          lease is
          reduced by $0.4 million.</font></div><br>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">&#160;</div>
            </div>
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">F-15</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
                HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
                TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="HDR">
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a href="#toc">Table
              of Contents</a></font></div>
          </div>
        </div><br>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Haven
          Eldercare, LLC Transaction</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
          January 2008, we purchased from General Electric Capital Corporation (&#8220;GE
          Capital&#8221;) a $39.0 million mortgage loan on seven facilities operated by Haven
          Eldercare, LLC (&#8220;Haven&#8221;) due October 2012.&#160;&#160;Prior to the acquisition
          of this mortgage, we had a $22.8 million second mortgage on these
          facilities.&#160;&#160;We now have a combined $61.8 million mortgage on these
          facilities.&#160;&#160;We have an option to purchase these facilities that would
          allow us a fee simple interest in the facilities.&#160;&#160;If we exercise the
          purchase option, the seven facilities would be combined with an existing
          eight
          facilities master lease.&#160;&#160;We have historically consolidated this
          investment for reporting purposes, including the $39.0 million mortgage
          that GE
          Capital previously owned.&#160;&#160;The borrowers and guarantors under the
          mortgage, and the lessee, sublessees and guarantors in respect of the master
          lease are all debtors-in-possession in chapter 11 proceeding being jointly
          administered in the United States Bankruptcy Court for the District of
          Connecticut, New Haven Division.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We
          have
          evaluated our current receivables as well as our other investments with
          Haven
          and do not believe that reserves for impairment or for the collection of
          our
          current and straight-line receivables is warranted at December 31,
          2007.&#160;&#160;Our portion of Haven&#8217;s portfolio of assets continues to perform
          well.&#160;&#160;We also have adequate liquidity deposits to cover the
          outstanding current receivables.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Acquisitions</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
          table
          below summarizes the acquisitions completed during the years ended December
          31,
          2007 and 2006.&#160;&#160;The purchase price includes estimated transaction
          costs.&#160;&#160;On July 31, 2007, we completed a transaction with Litchfield
          to purchase a 100% interest in five (5) SNFs for a total investment of
          $39.5
          million as described above under &#8220;Signature Holding II, LLC.&#8221;&#160;&#160;We have
          finalized the purchase price amount at $39.5 million.&#160;&#160;The amount
          allocated to land, building and personal property is $6.3 million, $32.1
          million
          and $1.1 million, respectively.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
          the
          third quarter of 2006, we completed two transactions: (i) on August 1,
          2006, we
          purchase a 100% interest in 30 SNFs and one independent living center from
          Litchfield; and (ii) on September 1, 2006, we purchased a 100% interest
          in a
          facility located in Pennsylvania, the combined total investment was $178.9
          million.&#160;&#160;We have finalized the purchase price allocation of the
          $178.9 million.&#160;&#160;The amount allocated to land, building and personal
          property is $15.4 million, $154.4 million and $7.5 million, respectively,
          including $1.8 million in land and building classified as held for
          sale.&#160;&#160;We also allocated $1.6 million to a below-market
          lease.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
          acquired properties are included in our results of operations from the
          respective date of acquisition.&#160;&#160;The following unaudited pro forma
          results of operations reflect these transactions as if each had occurred
          on
          January 1 of the year of the acquisition and the immediately preceding
          year.&#160;&#160;In our opinion, all significant adjustments necessary to
          reflect the effects of the acquisitions have been made.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>

                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">0.80</font></td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>

                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="64%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px">

                    per share &#8211; dilutedDiluted</font></div>

                    June 2005, we sold four SNFs to subsidiaries of Alden Management
                    Services,
                    Inc., who previously leased the facilities from us.&#160;&#160;All four
                    facilities are located in Illinois.&#160;&#160;The sales price totaled
                    approximately $17 million.&#160;&#160;We received net cash proceeds of
                    approximately $12 million plus a secured promissory note of approximately
                    $5.4 million.&#160;&#160;The sale resulted in a non-cash accounting loss

          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">F-17</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
                HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
                TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="HDR">
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a href="#toc">Table
              of Contents</a></font></div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              <tr valign="top">
                <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">
                  <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
                    March 2005, we sold three SNFs, located in Florida and California,
                    for
                    their approximate net book value realizing cash proceeds of approximately
                    $6 million, net of closing costs and other expenses.&#160;&#160;The
                    results of these operations are included in discontinued
                    operations.</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
          4 - MORTGAGE NOTES RECEIVABLE</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Mortgage
          notes receivable relate to
          nine fixed-rate mortgages on long-term care facilities.&#160;&#160;The mortgage
          notes are secured by first mortgage liens on the borrowers' underlying
          real
          estate and personal property.&#160;&#160;The mortgage notes receivable relate to
          facilities located in four states, operated by five independent healthcare
          operating companies.&#160;&#160;We monitor compliance with mortgages and when
          necessary have initiated collection, foreclosure and other proceedings
          with
          respect to certain outstanding loans.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2007, we
          have no foreclosed property and none of our mortgages were in foreclosure
          proceedings.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2007
          and 2006 Mortgage Note Activity</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In
          2007, we invested $0.3 million in a
          second mortgage with one of our operators.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>During
          the second quarter of 2006, we
          received approximately $10 million in proceeds on a mortgage loan payoff
          from
          Hickory Creek Healthcare Foundation, Inc. for mortgages on 15 facilities
          located
          in Indiana, representing 619 beds.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>During
          the first quarter of 2006,
          Haven, an existing operator of ours, entered into a $39 million first mortgage
          loan with GE Capital (collectively, &#8220;GE Loan&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Haven used the $39
          million of proceeds to partially repay on a $62 million mortgage it has
          with
          us.&#160;&#160;Simultaneously, we subordinated the payment of our remaining $23
          million of the mortgage note, due in October 2012, to that of the GE
          Loan.&#160;&#160;As a result of this transaction, the interest rate on our
          remaining mortgage note to Haven rose from 10% to approximately 15%, with
          annual
          escalators.&#160;&#160;In accordance with FIN 46R, we consolidated the financial
          statements and related real estate of the Haven&#160;subsidiary that is the
          debtor under our mortgage note.&#160;&#160;The Haven subsidiary's only business
          activity is to own the seven facilities subject to our mortgage and lease
          them
          to another Haven affiliate.&#160; See Note 3 &#8211; Properties.&#160;&#160;In January
          2008, we purchased the first mortgage loan from GE Capital.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
          outstanding principal amounts of mortgage notes receivable, net of allowances,
          were as follows:</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>

                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

              <tr>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="76%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px">

                    securities and other</font></div>
