          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 45pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">At
          December 31, 2007, we had 10 notes receivable, with maturities ranging
          from on
          demand to 2016.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2006, we had 11 notes receivable,
          with maturities ranging from on demand to 2016.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2007
          and 2006, we had reserves of approximately $2.2 million on two
          notes.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>For
          the year ended December 31, 2007
          and 2006, apart from the normal monthly loan payment, we had the following
          transactions that impacted our other investments:</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2007
          Transactions</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Senior
          Management Debtor-in-Possession Financing Agreement</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In
          May 2007, we entered into a
          Debtor-in-Possession Financing Agreement (&#8220;DIP&#8221;) with one of our operators,
          providing up to $6.0 million to maintain its day-to-day operation while
          it was
          undergoing its workout plan.&#160;&#160;The term of the DIP was May 2007 through
          August 2007.&#160;&#160;The balance was paid off in August 2007.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Alden
          Management Note Payoff</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In
          August 2007, we received
          approximately $4.0 million in proceeds on a loan payoff.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2006
          Transactions</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Advocat
          Subordinated Debt and Convertible Preferred Stock Investments</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              <tr valign="top">
                <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                  <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Under
                    our 2000 restructuring agreement with Advocat, we received the
                    following:&#160;&#160;(i) 393,658 shares of Advocat&#8217;s Series B non-voting,
                    redeemable (on or after September 30, 2007), convertible preferred
                    stock,
                    which was convertible into up to 706,576 shares of Advocat&#8217;s common stock
                    (representing&#160;&#160;9.9% of the outstanding shares of Advocat&#8217;s
                    common stock on a fully diluted, as-converted basis and accruing
                    dividends
                    at 7% per annum); and (ii) a secured convertible subordinated
                    note in the
                    amount of $1.7 million bearing interest at 7% per annum with
                    a September
                    30, 2007 maturity, (collectively the &#8220;Initial Advocat
                    Securities&#8221;).&#160;&#160;On October 20, 2006, we restructured our
                    relationship with Advocat (the &#8220;Second Advocat Restructuring&#8221;) by entering
                    into a Restructuring Stock Issuance and Subscription Agreement
                    with
                    Advocat (the &#8220;2006 Advocat Agreement&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the 2006
                    Advocat Agreement, we exchanged the Initial Advocat Securities
                    issued to
                    us in November 2000 for 5,000 shares of Advocat&#8217;s Series C
                    non-convertible, redeemable (at our option after September 30,
                    2010)
                    preferred stock with a face value of approximately $4.9 million
                    and a
                    dividend rate of 7% payable quarterly, and a secured non-convertible
                    subordinated note in the amount of $2.5 million maturing September
                    30,
                    2007 and bearing interest at 7% per
                    annum.</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              <tr valign="top">
                <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                  <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
                    accordance with FAS No. 115, the Advocat Series B security was
                    a compound
                    financial instrument.&#160;&#160;During the period of our ownership of
                    this security, the embedded derivative value of the conversion
                    feature was
                    recorded separately at fair market value in accordance with FAS
                    No.
                    133.&#160;&#160;The non-derivative portion of the security was classified
                    as an available-for-sale investment and was stated at its fair
                    value with
                    unrealized gains or losses recorded in accumulated other comprehensive
                    income.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2005, the fair value of the conversion
                    feature was $1.1 million and the fair value of the non-derivative
                    portion
                    of the security was $4.3 million.&#160;&#160;As a result of the Second
                    Advocat Restructuring, we recorded a gain of $1.1 million associated
                    with
                    the exchange of the Advocat Series B preferred stock.&#160;&#160;See Note
                    3 &#8211; Properties.</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>

              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">

            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a href="#toc">Table

        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              <tr valign="top">
                <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                  <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
                    accordance with FAS No. 114 and FAS No. 118, the $1.7 million
                    Advocat
                    secured convertible subordinated note was fully reserved and
                    accounted for
                    using the cost-recovery method applying cash received against
                    the
                    outstanding principal balance prior to recording interest
                    income.&#160;&#160;As a result of the Second Advocat Restructuring, we
                    obtained a secured non-convertible subordinated note from Advocat
                    in the
                    amount of $2.5 million.&#160;&#160;This note was recorded at its estimated
                    fair value of $2.5 million.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2006, the carrying
                    value of the note was $2.5 million.&#160;&#160;In addition, in 2006 a $2.5
                    million gain associated with the exchange of this note was
                    recorded.&#160;&#160;See Note 3 &#8211; Properties.&#160;&#160;The $2.5 million
                    note was paid off in August 2007.</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              <tr valign="top">
                <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                  <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As
                    a result of the Second Advocat Restructuring, we obtained 5,000
                    shares of
                    Advocat Series C non-convertible redeemable preferred
                    stock.&#160;&#160;This security was initially recorded at its estimated
                    fair value of $4.1 million.&#160;&#160;In accordance with FAS No. 115, we
                    have classified this security as held-to-maturity.&#160;&#160;Accordingly,
                    the carrying value of this security will be accreted to its mandatory
                    redemption value of $4.9 million.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2006 and
                    2007, the carrying value of this security was $4.1 million and
                    $4.3
                    million, respectively.</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Sun
          Healthcare Common Stock Investment</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              <tr valign="top">
                <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                  <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
                    accordance with FAS No. 115, in June 2005, we recorded a $3.4
                    million
                    provision for impairment to write-down our 760,000 share investment
                    in Sun
                    common stock to its then current fair market value of $4.9
                    million.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2005, the fair value of our Sun stock
                    investment was $5.0 million.</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              <tr valign="top">
                <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                  <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
                    the three months ended September 30, 2006, we sold our remaining
                    760,000
                    shares of Sun&#8217;s common stock for approximately $7.6 million, realizing a
                    gain on the sale of these securities of approximately $2.7
                    million.</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
          6 - CONCENTRATION OF RISK</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>As
          of December 31, 2007, our portfolio
          of domestic investments consisted of 236 healthcare facilities, located
          in 27
          states and operated by 28 third-party operators.&#160;&#160;Our gross investment
          in these facilities, net of impairments and before reserve for uncollectible
          loans, totaled approximately $1.3 billion at December 31, 2007, with
          approximately 98% of our real estate investments related to long-term care
          facilities.&#160;&#160;This portfolio is made up of 222 long-term healthcare
          facilities, two rehabilitation hospitals owned and leased to third parties,
          fixed rate mortgages on 9 long-term healthcare facilities and three facilities
          held for sale.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2007, we also held miscellaneous
          investments of approximately $14 million, consisting primarily of secured
          loans
          to third-party operators of our facilities.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>At
          December 31, 2007, approximately 29%
          of our real estate investments were operated by two public companies: Sun
          (18%)
          and Advocat (11%).&#160;&#160;Our largest private company operators (by
          investment) were CommuniCare Healthcare Services (&#8220;CommuniCare &#8220;) (15%),
          Signature Holding II, LLC (11%), Haven Healthcare (9%), Guardian LTC Management,
          Inc. (7%), Nexion Health Inc. (6%) and Essex Healthcare Corporation
          (6%).&#160;&#160;No other operator represents more than 4% of our
          investments.&#160;&#160;The three states in which we had our highest
          concentration of investments were Ohio (22%), Florida (13%) and Pennsylvania
          (8%) at December 31, 2007.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>For
          the year ended December 31, 2007,
          our revenues from operations totaled $159.6 million, of which approximately
          $30.9 million were from Sun (19%), $23.4 million from Advocat (15%) and
          $21.2
          million from CommuniCare (13%).&#160;&#160;No other operator generated more than
          9% of our revenues from operations for the year ended December 31,
          2007.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Sun
          and Advocat are subject to the
          reporting requirements of the SEC and are required to file with the SEC
          annual
          reports containing audited financial information and quarterly reports
          containing unaudited interim financial information.&#160;&#160;Sun&#8217;s and
          Advocat&#8217;s filings with the SEC can be found at the SEC&#8217;s website at
          www.sec.gov.&#160;&#160;We are providing this data for information purposes
          only, and you are encouraged to obtain Sun&#8217;s and Advocat&#8217;s publicly available
          filings from the SEC.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div><br>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">&#160;</div>
            </div>
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center">

          </div>

            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">F-20</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
                HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES

            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a href="#toc">Table
              of Contents</a></font></div>

        </div><br>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
          7 - LEASE AND MORTGAGE DEPOSITS</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We
          obtain liquidity deposits and
          letters of credit from most operators pursuant to our lease and mortgage
          contracts with the operators.&#160;&#160;These generally represent the rental
          and mortgage interest for periods ranging from three to six months with
          respect
          to certain of its investments.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2007, we held $2.1
          million in such liquidity deposits and $30.4 million in letters of
          credit.&#160;&#160;The liquidity deposits may be applied in the event of lease
          and loan defaults, subject to applicable limitations under bankruptcy law
          with
          respect to operators filing under Chapter 11 of the United States Bankruptcy
          Code.&#160;&#160;Liquidity deposits are recorded as restricted cash on our
          consolidated balance sheet.&#160;&#160;Additional security for rental and
          mortgage interest revenue from operators is provided by covenants regarding
          minimum working capital and net worth, liens on accounts receivable and
          other
          operating assets of the operators, provisions for cross default, provisions
          for
          cross-collateralization and by corporate/personal guarantees.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
          8 - BORROWING ARRANGEMENTS</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Secured
          Borrowings</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>At
          December 31, 2007, we had $48.0
          million outstanding under our $255 million revolving senior secured credit
          facility (&#8220;Credit Facility&#8221;) and $2.1 million was utilized for the issuance of
          letters of credit, leaving availability of $204.9 million.&#160;&#160;The $48.0
          million of outstanding borrowings had a blended interest rate of 6.15%
          at
          December 31, 2007.&#160;&#160;Borrowings under the credit agreement are due
          March 2010.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Pursuant
          to Section 2.01 of the credit
          agreement dated as of March 31, 2006 that governs the Credit Facility,
          we were
          permitted under certain circumstances to increase our available borrowing
          base
          under the credit agreement from $200 million up to an aggregate of $300
          million.&#160;&#160;Effective February 22, 2007, we exercised our right to
          increase the available revolving commitment under Section 2.01 of the credit
          agreement from $200 million to $255 million and we consented to add 18
          of our
          properties to the borrowing base assets under the credit
          agreement.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2007, we pledged real estate assets with a
          gross book value of $281.0 million as collateral for the Credit
          Facility.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2007 and 2006, we had letters of credit
          outstanding of $2.1 million and $2.5 million, respectively.&#160;&#160;The
          blended borrowing interest rate for 2007 and 2006 was 6.15% and 6.60%,
          respectively.&#160;&#160;In 2007, we paid approximately $0.7 million in fees and
          expenses associated with increasing the available revolving
          commitment.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our
          long-term borrowings require us to
          meet certain property level financial covenants and corporate financial
          covenants, including prescribed leverage, fixed charge coverage, minimum
          net
          worth, limitations on additional indebtedness and limitations on dividend
          payouts.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2007, we were in compliance with all
          property level and corporate financial covenants.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The
          credit agreement has certain
          financial covenants that limit the distribution of dividends paid during
          a
          fiscal quarter to no more than 95% of our aggregate cumulative Funds From
          Operations (&#8220;FFO&#8221;) as defined in the Credit Agreement unless a greater
          distribution is required to maintain REIT status.&#160;&#160;The Credit
          Agreement defines FFO as net income (or loss) plus depreciation and amortization
          and shall be adjusted for charges related to: (i) restructuring our debt;
          (ii)
          redemption of preferred stock; (iii) litigation charges up to $5.0 million;
          (iv)
          non-cash charges for accounts and notes receivable up to $5.0 million;
          (v)
          non-cash compensation related expenses; (vi) non-cash impairment charges;
          and
          (vii) tax liabilities in an amount not to exceed $8.0 million.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Unsecured
          Borrowings</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Other
          Long-Term Borrowings</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>As
          previously reported, during the
          three months ended March 31, 2006, Haven entered into a $39 million first
          mortgage loan with GE Capital.&#160;&#160;Haven used the $39 million of proceeds
          from the GE Loan to partially repay a portion of a $62 million mortgage
          it has
          with us.&#160;&#160;Simultaneously, we subordinated the payment of its remaining
          $23 million mortgage note to that of the GE Loan.&#160;&#160;In conjunction with
          the above transactions and the application of FIN 46R, we consolidated
          the
          financial statements and real estate of the Haven entity into our financial
          statements.&#160;&#160;In January 2008, we purchased the GE Loan from GE
          Capital.</font></div><br>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">&#160;</div>
            </div>
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">F-21</font></div>

              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">

                HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
                TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font></div>
            </div>

                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="76%">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; TEXT-INDENT: -27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 10.8pt"></font>Other
                    long-term
                    borrowings</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 6.7pt"></font>1,995</font></td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Fair
          value estimates are subjective in
          nature and are dependent on a number of important assumptions, including
          estimates of future cash flows, risks, discount rates and relevant comparable
          market information associated with each financial instrument (see Note
          2 &#8211;
Summary of Significant Accounting Policies).&#160;&#160;The use of different
          market assumptions and estimation methodologies may have a material effect
          on
          the reported estimated fair value amounts.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, the estimates
          presented above are not necessarily indicative of the amounts we would
          realize
          in a current market exchange.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The
          following methods and assumptions
          were used in estimating fair value disclosures for financial
          instruments.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              <tr valign="top">
                <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                  <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Cash
                    and cash equivalents:&#160;&#160;The carrying amount of cash and cash
                    equivalents reported in the balance sheet approximates fair value
                    because
                    of the short maturity of these instruments (i.e., less than 90
                    days).</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              <tr valign="top">
                <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                  <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Mortgage
                    notes receivable:&#160;&#160;The fair values of the mortgage notes
                    receivables are estimated using a discounted cash flow analysis,
                    using
                    interest rates being offered for similar loans to borrowers with
                    similar
                    credit ratings.</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              <tr valign="top">
                <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                  <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Other
                    investments:&#160;&#160;Other investments are primarily comprised of: (i)
                    notes receivable; (ii) a redeemable non-convertible preferred
                    security;
                    and (iii) a subordinated debt instrument of a publicly traded
                    company in
                    2006 and paid off in 2007.&#160;&#160;The fair values of notes receivable
                    are estimated using a discounted cash flow analysis, using interest
                    rates
                    being offered for similar loans to borrowers with similar credit
                    ratings.&#160;&#160;The fair value of the marketable securities are
                    estimated using discounted cash flow and volatility assumptions
                    or, if
                    available, a quoted market value.</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              <tr valign="top">
                <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                  <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Revolving
                    lines of credit:&#160;&#160;The carrying values of our borrowings under
                    variable rate agreements approximate their fair
                    values.</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              <tr valign="top">
                <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                  <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Senior
                    notes and other long-term borrowings:&#160;&#160;The fair value of our
                    borrowings under fixed rate agreements are estimated based on
                    open market
                    trading activity provided by a third
                    party.</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
          10 &#8211; TAXES</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We
          were organized, have operated, and
          intend to continue to operate in a manner that enables us to qualify for
          taxation as a REIT under Sections 856 through 860 of the Internal Revenue
          Code.&#160;&#160;On a quarterly and annual basis we perform several analyses to
          test our compliance within the REIT taxation rules.&#160;&#160;In order to
          qualify as a REIT, we are required to: (i) distribute dividends (other
          than
          capital gain dividends) to our stockholders in an amount at least equal
          to (A)
          the sum of (a) 90% of our "REIT taxable income" (computed without regard
          to the
          dividends paid deduction and our net capital gain), and (b) 90% of the
          net
          income (after tax), if any, from foreclosure property, minus (B) the sum
          of
          certain items of non-cash income on an annual basis, (ii) ensure that at
          least
          75% and 95%, respectively of our gross income is generated from qualifying
          sources that are described in the REIT tax law, (iii) ensure that at least
          75%
          of our assets consist of qualifying assets, such as real property, mortgages,
          and other qualifying assets described in the REIT tax law, (iv) ensure
          that we
          do not own greater than 10% of the voting or value of any one security,
          (v)
          ensure that we don&#8217;t own either debt or equity securities of another company
          that are in excess of 5% of our total assets and (vi) ensure that no more
          that
          20% of our assets are invested in one or more taxable REIT subsidiaries.
          In
          addition to the income and asset tests, the REIT rules require that no
          less than
          100 shareholders own shares or an interest in the REIT and that five or
          fewer
          individuals do not own (directly or indirectly) more than 50% of the shares
          or
          proportionate interest in the REIT.&#160;&#160;If we fail to qualify as a REIT
          in any tax year, we will be subject to federal income tax on our taxable
          income
          at regular corporate rates and may not be able to qualify as a REIT for
          the four
          subsequent years.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">F-23</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
                HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
                TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="HDR">
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a href="#toc">Table
              of Contents</a></font></div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;We
          are also
          subject to federal taxation of 100% of the derived net income if we sell
          or
          dispose of property, other than foreclosure property, that we held primarily
          for
          sale to customers in the ordinary course of a trade or business.&#160;&#160;We
          believe that we do not hold assets for sale to customers in the ordinary
          course
          of business and that none of the assets currently held for sale or that
          have
          been sold would be considered a prohibited transaction within the REIT
          taxation
          rules.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>So
          long as we qualify as a REIT we
          generally will not be subject to Federal income taxes on the REIT taxable
          income
          that we distribute to stockholders, subject to certain exceptions.&#160;&#160;In
          2007, we paid preferred and common dividend payments of $81.3 million which
          satisfies the 2007 REIT requirements relating to the distribution of our
          REIT
          Taxable Income.&#160;&#160;&#160;On a quarterly and annual basis we tested our
          compliance within the REIT taxation rules described above to ensure that
          we were
          in compliance with the rules.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Subject
          to the limitation described
          above under the REIT asset test rules, we are permitted to own up to 100%
          of the
          stock of one or more TRSs.&#160;&#160;Currently, we have one TRS that is taxable
          as a corporation and that pays federal, state and local income tax on its
          net
          income at the applicable corporate rates.&#160;&#160;The TRS had a net operating
          loss carry-forward as of December 31, 2007 of $1.1 million.&#160;&#160;The loss
          carry-forward was fully reserved with a valuation allowance due to uncertainties
          regarding realization.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In
          the fourth quarter of 2006, we
          determined that, due to certain provisions of the Series B preferred stock
          issued to us by Advocat in 2000 in connection with a restructuring, Advocat
          may&#160;have been&#160;considered to be a &#8220;related party tenant&#8221; under the
          rules applicable to REITs.&#160; As a result, we (1) took steps in 2006 to
          restructure our relationship with Advocat and ownership of Advocat securities
          in
          order to avoid having the rent received from Advocat classified as received
          from
          a &#8220;related party tenant&#8221; in taxable years after 2006, and (2) submitted a
          request to the IRS on December 15, 2006, that in the event that rental
          income
          received by us from Advocat would not be qualifying income for purposes
          of the
          REIT gross income tests, such failure during taxable years prior to 2007
          was due
          to reasonable cause.&#160;&#160;During 2007, we entered into closing agreement
          with the IRS covering all affected taxable periods prior to 2007 to the
          effect
          that our failure to meet the 95% gross income tests as a result of the
          Advocat
          rental income being considered to be received from a &#8220;related party tenant&#8221; was
          due to reasonable cause.&#160;&#160;In connection with reaching this agreement
          with the IRS as to the Advocat related party tenant income issue, we paid
          to the
          IRS penalty income taxes and interest totaling approximately $5.6 million
          for
          the tax years 2002 through 2006. We had previously accrued $5.6 million
          of
          income tax liabilities as of December 31, 2006.&#160;&#160;As a result of the
          execution of closing agreement with the IRS as to our taxable years 2002
          through
          2006 and the restructuring of our relationship with Advocat in October
          2006, we
          believe we have fully resolved all tax issues relating to rental income
          received
          from Advocat prior to 2007 and have been advised by tax counsel that we
          will not
          receive any non-qualifying related party tenant income from Advocat in
          2007 and
          future fiscal years. Accordingly, we do not expect to incur tax expense
          associated with related party tenant income in periods commencing January
          1,
          2007.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><a name="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"><br></a></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
          11 - RETIREMENT ARRANGEMENTS</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our
          company has a 401(k) Profit Sharing
          Plan covering all eligible employees.&#160;&#160;Under this plan, employees are
          eligible to make contributions, and we, at our discretion, may match
          contributions and make a profit sharing contribution.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We
          have a Deferred Compensation Plan
          which is an unfunded plan under which we can award units that result in
          participation in the dividends and future growth in the value of our common
          stock.&#160;&#160;There are no outstanding units as of December 31,
          2007.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">

        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
          Amounts charged to operations with respect to these retirement arrangements
          totaled approximately $77,600, $62,700 and $55,400 in 2007, 2006 and 2005,
          respectively.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
          12 &#8211; STOCKHOLDERS&#8217; EQUITY</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Stockholders&#8217;
          Equity</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">7.130
          Million Common Stock
          Offering</font></font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On
          April 3, 2007, we completed an
          underwritten public offering of 7,130,000 shares our common stock at $16.75
          per
          share, less underwriting discounts. The sale included 930,000 shares sold
          in
          connection with the exercise of an over-allotment option granted to the
          underwriters.&#160;&#160;We received approximately $112.9 million in net
          proceeds from the sale of the shares, after deducting underwriting discounts
          and
          offering expenses.&#160;&#160;UBS Investment Bank acted as sole book-running
          manager for the offering.&#160;&#160;Banc of America Securities LLC, Deutsche
          Bank Securities and Stifel Nicolaus acted as co-managers for the
          offering.&#160;&#160;The net proceeds were used to repay indebtedness under our
          Credit Facility.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Dividend
          Reinvestment and Common Stock Purchase Plan</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We
          have a Dividend Reinvestment and
          Common Stock Purchase Plan (the &#8220;DRSPP&#8221;) that allows for the reinvestment of
          dividends and the optional purchase of our common stock.&#160;&#160;We currently
          offer shares under the DRSPP at a 1% discount to market.&#160;&#160;In 2007, we
          reinstated the DRSPP and issued 1,189,779 shares of common stock for
          approximately $18.9 million in net proceeds.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">5.175
          Million Common Stock Offering</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On
          November 21, 2005, we closed an
          underwritten public offering of 5,175,000 shares of Omega common stock
          at $11.80
          per share, less underwriting discounts.&#160;&#160;The sale included 675,000
          shares sold in connection with the exercise of an over-allotment option
          granted
          to the underwriters.&#160;&#160;We received approximately $58 million in net
          proceeds from the sale of the shares, after deducting underwriting discounts
          and
          before estimated offering expenses.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Series
          B Preferred Dividends</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In
          March 2005, our Board of Directors
          authorized the redemption of all outstanding 2.0 million shares of our
          Series B
          Preferred Stock.&#160;&#160;The Series B Preferred Stock was redeemed on May 2,
          2005 for $25 per share, plus $0.55104 per share in accrued and unpaid dividends
          through the redemption date, for an aggregate redemption price of $25.55104
          per
          share.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">8.375%
          Series D Preferred Stock Offering</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On
          February 10, 2004, we closed on the
          sale of 4,739,500 shares of our 8.375% Series D cumulative redeemable preferred
          stock (the &#8220;Series D Preferred Stock&#8221;) at a price of $25 per
          share.&#160;&#160;The Series D Preferred Stock is listed on the NYSE under the
          symbol &#8220;OHI PrD.&#8221;&#160;&#160;Dividends on the Series D Preferred Stock are
          cumulative from the date of original issue and are payable
          quarterly.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2006, the aggregate liquidation preference
          of the Series D Preferred Stock was $118.5 million.&#160;&#160;(See Note 14 &#8211;
Dividends).&#160; <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We
          may
          not redeem the 8.375% Series D cumulative redeemable preferred shares prior
          to
          February 10, 2009, except as necessary to preserve our status as a real
          estate
          investment trust.&#160;&#160;On or after February 10, 2009, we may, at our
          option, redeem the 8.375% Series D cumulative redeemable preferred shares,
          in
          whole or from time to time in part, for $25.00 per 8.375% Series D cumulative
          redeemable preferred share in cash plus any accrued and unpaid distributions
          through the date of redemption.&#160;&#160;The 8.375% Series D cumulative
          redeemable preferred shares have no stated maturity, are not subject to
          any
          sinking fund and will remain outstanding indefinitely unless we redeem
          them.</font><br></font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">

              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">&#160;</div>

            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
                HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>

            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a href="#toc">Table
              of Contents</a></font></div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
          13 &#8211;STOCK-BASED COMPENSATION</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>We
          offer stock-based compensation to
          our employees that include stock options, restricted stock awards and
          performance share awards.&#160;&#160;Under the terms of our 2000 Stock Incentive
          Plan (the &#8220;2000 Plan&#8221;) and the 2004 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#8220;2004 Plan&#8221;), we
          reserved 3,500,000 shares and 3,000,000 shares of common stock,
          respectively.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Stock
          Options</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>The
          2000 and 2004 Plan allows for the
          issuance of stock options to employees, directors and consultants at exercise
          price equal to the Company&#8217;s common stock price on the date of
          grant.&#160;&#160;The 2000 Plan and 2004 Plan do not allow for a reduction in
          the exercise price after the date of grant, nor does it allow for an option
          to
          be cancelled in exchange for an option with a lower exercise price per
          share.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2007, there were 34,664 options outstanding
          under the 2000 Plan with a weighted average exercise price of $14.13 per
          share.&#160;&#160;We have not issued stock option to employees, directors or
          consultants since 2004.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>Cash
          received from the exercise under
          all stock-based payment arrangements for the year ended 2007, 2006 and
          2005 was
          $58 thousand, $0.9 million and $0.4 million, respectively.&#160;&#160;Cash used
          to settle equity instruments granted under stock-based payment arrangements
          for
          the year ended 2007, 2006 and 2005, was $0.8 million, $0.7 million and
          $1.4
          million, respectively.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Restricted
          Stock</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>Restricted
          stock awards are
          independent of stock option grants and are subject to forfeiture if employment
          terminates service prior to vesting.&#160;&#160;Prior to vesting, ownership of
          the shares cannot be transferred.&#160;&#160;The restricted stock has the same
          dividend and voting rights as the common stock.&#160;&#160;We expense the cost
          of these awards ratably over their vesting period.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>In
          2004, we granted 317,500 shares of
          restricted stock to four executive officers under the 2004 Plan.&#160;&#160;The
          shares vest thirty-three and one-third percent (33 1/3%) on each of January
          1,
          2005, January 1, 2006 and January 1, 2007 so long as the executive officer
          remains employed on the vesting date.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2007, there
          were no shares of unvested restricted stock outstanding.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>In
          May 2007, we granted 286,908
          shares of restricted stock to five executive officers under the 2004 Plan
          Stock
          Incentive Plan (the &#8220;2004 Plan&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The restricted stock award vests
          one-seventh on December 31, 2007 and two-sevenths on December 31, 2008,
          December
          31, 2009, and December 31, 2010, respectively, subject to continued employment
          on the vesting date (as defined in the agreements filed with the SEC on
          May 8,
          2007).&#160;&#160;As of December, 2007, there were 245,921 shares of unvested
          restricted stock outstanding.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>In
          addition, in January of each year
          we grant restricted stock to directors as part of the annual
          retainer.&#160;&#160;These shares vest ratably over a three year
          period.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The
          following table summarizes the
          activity in restricted stock for the years ended December 31, 2005, 2006
          and
          2007:</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>

        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;<font style="FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(1)&#160;
Total
          compensation cost to be recognized on the awards based on grant date fair
          value.</font></font><br></div><br>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">&#160;</div>
            </div>
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">F-26</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
                HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
              <div><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
                TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="HDR">
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a href="#toc">Table
              of Contents</a></font></div>
          </div>
        </div><br>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Performance
          Restricted Stock Units</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>Performance
          Restricted Stock Units
          (&#8220;PRSU&#8221;) are subject to forfeiture if the employee terminates service prior to
          vesting.&#160;&#160;Prior to vesting, ownership of the shares cannot be
          transferred.&#160;&#160;The dividends on the PRSUs accumulate and if vested are
          paid.&#160;&#160;We expense the cost of these awards ratably over their service
          period.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45pt"></font>In
          September 2004, we issued 317,500
          PRSU to four executive officers under the 2004 Plan.&#160;&#160;The PRSU fully
          vest into shares of common stock if our company attains $0.30 per share
          of
          adjusted funds from operations (&#8220;AFFO&#8221;) (as defined in the applicable restricted
          stock unit agreements) for two (2) consecutive quarters.&#160;&#160;During the
          third quarter of 2006, we achieved the vesting target as defined in the
          2004
          Plan, and recognized $3.3 million compensation expense associated with
          the
          vesting of the performance shares.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the terms of the
          performance restricted stock unit agreements, each of the executive officers
          did
          not receive the vested shares attributable to the performance restricted
          stock
          units until January 1, 2008.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2007, we had 317,500
          shares of PRSU vested and outstanding.&#160;&#160;We used the fair value on the
          grant date to determine the compensation cost.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>In
          May 2007, we awarded in two types
          of PRSU (annual and cliff vesting awards) to our five executives totaling
          247,992 shares.&#160;&#160;One half of the PRSU awards vest annually in equal
          increments on December 31, 2008, December 31, 2009, and December 31, 2010,
          respectively.&#160;&#160;The other half of the PRSU awards cliff vest on
          December 31, 2010.&#160;&#160;Vesting on both types of awards requires
          achievement of total shareholder return as defined in the agreements filed
          with
          the SEC on May 8, 2007.&#160;&#160;All vested shares will be delivered to the
          executive on January 2, 2011, provided that the executive is employed,
          or will
          be delivered on the date of cessation of service as an employee if the
          employee
          was terminated without cause or the employee terminated employment with
          cause.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>We
          used a Monte-Carlo model to
          estimate the fair value and derived service periods for PRSUs granted to
          the
          executives in May 2007.&#160;&#160;The following are some of the significant
          assumptions used in estimating the value of the awards:</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div>
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">

              <tr>
                <td align="left" valign="top" width="40%">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Closing
                    stock price on date of grant</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" valign="top" width="14%">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$17.06</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td align="left" valign="top" width="40%">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">20-day-average
                    stock price</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" valign="top" width="14%">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$17.27</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td align="left" valign="top" width="40%">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Risk-free
                    interest rate at time of grant</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" valign="top" width="14%">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">4.6%
                    to 5.1%</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td align="left" valign="top" width="40%">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Expected
                    volatility</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" valign="top" width="14%">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">24.0%
                    to 29.4%</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
